title: How to Allocate Money as a 40-Year-Old Couple Making $150,000 a Year
subtitle: A straightforward plan to maximize retirement savings and build wealth efficiently.
content:
How to Allocate Money as a 40-Year-Old Couple Making $150,000 a Year

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, tune into my new podcast by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Max Out Roth 401ks

We would start by maxing out our Roth 401ks, contributing $23,500 in 2025.

2. Lowest Cost Fund Investment

Next, we would invest those funds in the lowest cost fund we could find that tracks the S&P 500 or the total stock market.

3. Achieving Financial Freedom

We would be tax-free millionaires in just over 12 years, while still getting to live off of about $80,000 a year. That's it. That's all I would do. And yes, it can be that simple.
